title: Rachael Rollins
added: In July 2021, President [[Joe Biden]] nominated Rollins to be the [[United States Attorney]] for the [[United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts|District of Massachusetts]]. Republican U.S. Senator [[Tom Cotton]] said he would try to prevent Rollins from being confirmed, saying she supported policies that have contributed to an increase in violent crime. In September 2021, a committee vote to advance Rollins' nomination was delayed after Cotton wanted more time to convince colleagues to oppose her.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Estes |first1=Andrea |title=Rachael Rollins confirmation vote for U.S. attorney delayed by GOP senator |url=https://www.boston.com/uncategorized/politics/2021/09/23/rachael-rollins-confirmation-vote-for-u-s-attorney-delayed-by-gop-senator/ |access-date=30 September 2021 |work=www.boston.com |date=September 23, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Rachael Rollins' US Attorney Nomination Held Up By Republican Senator |url=https://boston.cbslocal.com/2021/09/23/rachael-rollins-us-attorney-nomination-tom-cotton-vote-republicans/ |access-date=30 September 2021 |publisher=CBS Boston |date=23 September 2021}}</ref>
